page.title: 18General Hospital - Bolton
page.content: {Bolton District General Hospital}was established in 1948 when the buildings of the original hospital transferred to the Ministry of Health. The first hospital was a Poor Law Institution of the Bolton Union, which comprised 26 townships, & was opened in l861 for a population of 130,270.An Infirmary was built adjacent to it in l899. The whole cost of the Workhouse, Lunatic Asylum and Hospital plus 22 acres of land, amounted to Â£33,000.Today the hospital occupies an area of 50 acres & has 893 beds for{surgery,paediatrics {medicine,obstetrics,dental,geriatrics, {gynaecology,coronary care,psychiatry, {emergency & out-patients.}Recent developments include The Princess Anne Maternity Unit in l977,M & J Blocks in l985,& a 50-bed Mental Illness Unit will open soon. { }
